deduplication.dedup

Classes

Baseline

Module Contents

class deduplication.dedup.Baseline[source]
hash_set

A set to store unique MD5 hashes of documents for deduplication. Used to track unique document hashes and identify duplicates in the dataset.

collection_deduplication(documents_dict)[source]

Groups documents into clusters based on identical content.

Parameters:

documents_dict – Dictionary where keys are document IDs and values are document strings.

Returns:

Dictionary where each key is a cluster ID and the value is a list of document IDs

that are considered duplicates or similar.

Return type:

clusters

detect_duplicates(documents)[source]

This function computes MD5 hashes of each document and identifies duplicates based on matching hash values.

Parameters:

documents – list of document strings to check for duplicates.

Returns:

a set containing unique MD5 hashes of the documents. duplicates: a list of duplicate documents.

Return type:

hash_set

length_based_baseline(documents)[source]

This function considers documents as duplicates if they have the same length. It compares the lengths of documents and identifies duplicates based on that.

Parameters:

documents – list of document strings to check for duplicates.

Returns:

a dictionary that maps document lengths to documents. duplicates: a list of duplicate documents based on length.

Return type:

length_map

tokenize(document)[source]

Tokenizes a document by splitting on spaces and returns a Counter of word frequencies.

Parameters:

document – A string representing a document.

Returns:

A Counter object with word frequencies.

word_count_baseline(documents, threshold=0.8)[source]

This function uses word count similarity to find duplicates. If two documents have a word overlap greater than the threshold, they are considered duplicates.

Parameters:

  • documents – A list of document strings.

  • threshold – The fraction of word overlap required to consider two documents as duplicates.

Returns:

A list of tuples where each tuple contains two documents that are considered duplicates.

Return type:

duplicates
